children.name: batch_policy
children.description: Configure a policy to flush batches of buffered messages.

children.name: count
children.description: The number of messages after which the batch is flushed. Set to `0` to disable count-based batching.

children.name: byte_size
children.description: The number of bytes at which the batch is flushed. Set to `0` to disable size-based batching.

children.name: period
children.description: The period of time after which an incomplete batch is flushed regardless of its size.

children.name: check
children.description: A xref:guides:bloblang/about.adoc[Bloblang query] that returns a boolean value indicating whether a message should end a batch.

children.name: processors
children.description: A list of xref:components:processors/about.adoc[processors] to apply to a batch as it is flushed. This allows you to aggregate and archive the batch however you see fit. Please note that all resulting messages are flushed as a single batch, therefore splitting the batch into smaller batches using these processors is a no-op.

children.name: endpoint
children.description: Specify a custom endpoint for the AWS API.

children.name: credentials
children.description: Manually configure the AWS credentials to use (optional). For more information, see xref:guides:cloud/aws.adoc[].

children.name: id
children.description: The ID of credentials to use.

children.name: secret
children.description: The secret for the credentials you want to use.

children.name: token
children.description: The token for the credentials you want to use. You must enter this value when using short-term credentials.

children.name: from_ec2_role
children.description: Use the credentials of a host EC2 machine configured to assume https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_use_switch-role-ec2.html[an IAM role associated with the instance^].

children.name: role_external_id
children.description: The external ID to use when assuming a role.
